p: As spice, the distinctive taste of summer savory led to its world-wide use and cultivation. The leaves are used as seasoning in stuffing and meat dishes, especially in Europe, while the sprigs can be boiled with peas or cabbage for improving digestion [ 2]. It is one of the ingredients of Herbes de Provence (together with rosemary, thyme and oregano); the extensive use as a spice, with no reported harmful effects suggests that summer savory it is safe for consumption as a spice.
